item.text: Each material is assigned a Base Score using Life Cycle Inventory information that convers the life cycle from Cradle to Gate.
This Quantitative Score using the same environmental impact areas and scale to enable relative comparisons.

We can start our analysis with a material. We'll follow that material through processing steps and accumulate the information we use for scoring along the way. Let's say we start with [[Cotton in the Field]].

We can start our analysis with a material. We can start with, say, [[Cotton Fabric]]. Or we can follow a material through processing steps and accumulate the information we use for scoring along the way as we do with [[Cotton in the Field]].
We can start our analysis with a material. We can start with, say, [[Cotton Fabric]].
We can follow a material through processing steps and accumulate the information we use for scoring along the way as we do with [[Cotton in the Field]].
We can drill down on a specific material such as [[Cotton Fabric]].
We can see a summary of indicators  on a material by material basis, such as [[Cotton Fabric]].
Each material is assigned a Base Score using Life Cycle Inventory information that covers the life cycle from Cradle to Gate.
Each material is assigned a Base Material Score using Life Cycle Inventory information that covers the life cycle from Cradle to Gate.
This Quantitative Score uses the same environmental impact areas and scale to enable relative comparisons.
